activities:
cerenade case management cloud solution is used by EU/EEA and/or Switzerland customers to capture client information.
Cerenade uses personal information that they receive from EU/EEA and/or Switzerland customers primarily for (1) customer support activities; (2) sales and marketing activities as permissible under applicable law; (3) enabling and providing online services, such as but not limited to software as a service offerings; and (4) internal business processes such as financial processing and management, fraud detection and prevention, and compliance with governmental, legislative and regulatory bodies. In some instances when Cerenade is providing online product services to customers, Cerenade may receive and process personal information on behalf of these customers as a data processor. In Cerenade’s capacity as a data processor, Cerenade acts on the instructions of these customers and does not own the personal information it may process on the customers’ behalf. As a data processor, Cerenade uses reasonable physical, electronic, and administrative safeguards to protect personal information from loss; misuse; or unauthorized access, disclosure, alteration, or destruction. Customers that use an online product service are responsible for complying with all other obligations in relation to personal information they may collect.
eucountries: Austria, Belgium, Bulgaria, Cyprus, Czech Republic, Denmark, Estonia, Finland, France, Germany, Greece, Hungary, Iceland, Ireland, Italy, Latvia, Liechtenstein, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Malta, Netherlands, Norway, Poland, Portugal, Romania, Slovakia, Slovenia, Spain, Sweden, Switzerland, United Kingdom
personaldata: organization, client, customer, trial data processed both On-line, and Off-line.
